TopicTitle: VTOL Challenge: Make a VTOL to get to the Island Strip

Articles.Content:
OK, here is an easy one. Make a VTOL that can fly and land on the Island Landing Strip

Extra kudos to those that also have the ability to:

1 Rover around on wheels

2 Float like a boat

3 Can maneuver on water so it can get out of the water if needed

4 Can take off from the water

5 Can carry Kerbals

6 Has a long range

7 Can obtain orbit (big kudos on this one)

8 Has emergency parachutes (Kerbal lives are important too ya know)

Here is mine...

As luck would have it I've just released one! Now let's see...

Extra kudos to those that also have the ability to:
1 Rover around on wheels - Nope
2 Float like a boat Yep
3 Can maneuver on water so it can get out of the water if needed Nope
4 Can take off from the water Yep
5 Can carry Kerbals Yep
6 Has a long range Yeah
7 Can obtain orbit (big kudos on this one) No... (although I do have a version that can)
8 Has emergency parachutes (Kerbal lives are important too ya know) Yes it has, and they are!

Cupcake...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/42602-Look-Mum-no-cockpit%21

5x Kudos Cupcake.

Nice looking VTOL too.

I forgot to say but mine can't get orbit either. I used to have another that could, but couldn't float or have the other features.

Oh, BTW, very cool video too. Enjoyed it much.

Edited July 26, 2013 by Bothersome

Cheers, I might have another crack at it when my SSTO version is ready, if that's okay...

Cupcake...

5x Kudos Cupcake.

Nice looking VTOL too.

I forgot to say but mine can't get orbit either. I used to have another that could, but couldn't float or have the other features.

Oh, BTW, very cool video too. Enjoyed it much.
I have tons of VTOLS, but not a picture of one landing on the runway >.<

Hey Cupcake, that's a pretty cute n' spunky looking VTOL! I bet your Kerbalnauts will be zipping all over the place in their lunch breaks.

The challenge probably specifies using stock parts, but I can't bear going back to using them due to the general fuggliness and lack of basic geometric parts for making things 'purdy'. If I can't make a craft functional AND stylish, I tend not to make it...

I am pleased to say that I have just completed a VTOL challenge of my own though... With a VTOL capable plane made with the B9 parts I have just circumnavigated Kerbin It took about an hour and I spent most of the trip skimming the atmosphere between 22-33 km up. Top speed was 2150 m/s or so, which also makes the craft truly hypersonic. I had to stop Jeb from going on EVA so he could "touch the fiery stuff" outside the window. Boy, was he tempted. Most insanely, I used just over 200 units of fuel! (I guess the engines may be a little TOO efficient for realistic Kerbal-tech, although k/w wise they aren't over-powered).

Definitely one of my most successful planes so far, although not the fastest. (I think some of my Sasquatch Marmalade "stealth" planes hit 2400 m/s).

Have a look at the B9 parts - they include simple to use VTOL engines and you can have some fun with quick builds. They look pretty cool too.
